duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage the personnel in the department in decontaminating, cleaning, packaging and sterilizing all instruments, equipment and other supplies used in the hospital.
Plan and provide sterile processing services for the OR and other departments.
Maintain equipment and ensure appropriate documentation is available.
Implement staffing patterns, work schedules, and call schedules.
Analyze sterilization logs for accuracy and completion to verify conformity to standards of sterilization and safety, meeting regulatory requirements.
Provide positive leadership through orientation, counseling, coaching, and development of staff to effect performance improvement and create good employee morale.
Collaborate and communicate effectively with leadership concerning clinical and staff issues, department status, and specific projects.
Demonstrate awareness and compliance with applicable AAMI, OSHA, AORN, Joint Commission, Federal, State and agency laws, regulations, guidelines and professional standards.
Participate in developing and implementing policies and procedures based on laws, regulations, and professional standards.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or GED, Certified Sterile Processing Technician - The Certification Board for Sterile Processing and Distribution, Inc
